article.title: Carol_Kane
article.paragraph: Carolyn Laurie"Carol"Kane(born June 18, 1952)is anAmericansAmericanstage, screen and televisionactoractress. She became known in the 1970s in films such asHester Street (film)Hester Street(for which she received anAcademy Awardnomination) andAnnie Hall. She appeared on the television seriesTaxi (TV series)Taxiin the early 1980s, as the wife ofLatka GravasLatka, the character played byAndy Kaufman, winning twoEmmy Awardsfor her work. She has played the character ofMadame Morriblein the musicalWicked (musical)Wicked, both in regional productions and on Broadway from 2005 to 2014.
article.heading: Early life
article.paragraph: Kane was born inCleveland,Ohio, the daughter of Joy, ajazzsinger, teacher, dancer, and pianist, and Michael Kane, an architect who worked for theWorld Bank."Carol Kane Biography (1952)"filmreference.com, accessed August 27, 2011Her family isJewish, and her grandparents emigrated fromRussia.Wayback20070927230010http://www.open.org/glennab/carolkanefanbio.htmDead linkAugust 2011Her parents divorced when she was 12 years old.Wayback20070927230511http://www.open.org/glennab/cktvguidemay1983.htmDead linkAugust 2011She attended theCherry Lawn School, a progressive boarding school inDarien, Connecticut, until 1965."Cherry Lawn School, Class of 1965"CherryLawnSchool.org, accessed August 27, 2011"Cherry Lawn School Photo Of The Month, October 1999"CherryLawnSchool.org, accessed August 27, 2011She attended theProfessional Children's School, in New York City, and made her professional theatre debut in a 1966 production ofThe Prime of Miss Jean Brodie (novel)The Prime of Miss Jean Brodie, starringTammy Grimes."Carol Kane Biography"YahooMovies, accessed August 27, 2011
article.heading: Career
Television
article.paragraph: multiple issuesyMarch 2015}}{{prose|section|dateKane is perhaps best known for her portrayal of Simka Dahblitz-Gravas, wife of Latka Gravas (Andy Kaufman), on the American television seriesTaxi (TV series)Taxi, from 1981 to 1983. Kane earned twoEmmy Awardsfor her work in the series.

Kane was a regular on the 1986NBCseriesAll Is Forgiven, a regular on the 199091NBCseriesAmerican Dreamer (television)American Dreamer, guest-starred on a 1994 episode ofSeinfeldand had a supporting role in the short-lived 199697 sitcomPearl (TV series)Pearl, which starredRhea Perlman.
Carol Kane also appeared in an episode of Tales From the Crypt called "Judy, You're Not Yourself Today".
She also appeared in the NBC television live action production ofThe Year Without a Santa Claus (2006 film)The Year Without a Santa Clausin December 2006.
In January 2009, Kane appeared in the TV seriesTwo and a Half Menas the mother of Alan Harper's receptionist.Two and a Half Men: Thank God for Scoliosis Season 6"TV.com, accessed August 27, 2011

In March 2010, Kane appeared in the TV seriesUgly Bettyas Justin Suarez's acting teacher. Then, in 2014, Kane had a recurring role in the TV seriesGotham (TV series)Gothamas Gertrude Kapelput,Penguin (comics)Oswald Cobblepot's (Penguin's)mother.IMDb.comGotham. Spirit of the Goat episode accessed October 28. 2014In 2015, she was cast as Lillian, the landlord to the title character, on theNetflixoriginal seriesUnbreakable Kimmy Schmidt.cite webhttp://www.voxmagazine.com/2015/03/unbreakable-kimmy-schmidt-is-a-great-addition-to-netflix-lineupUnbreakable Kimmy Schmidt is a great addition to Netflix lineup {{!}} Vox MagazineVox Magazine[[Columbia Missourian]]HaveyMaxMarch 20, 2015March 22, 2015
article.heading: Movies
article.paragraph: She also appeared inThe Last Detail(1973), "Norman Loves Rose" (1982),Dog Day Afternoon(1975),The Princess Bride (film)The Princess Bride(1987) andScrooged(1988), in whichVariety (magazine)Varietycalled her "unquestionably [the] pic's comic highlight.""Scrooged"Variety (requires registration), retrieved August 27, 2011
In 1998, she played Mother Duck on the cartoon movieThe First Snow of Winter. In 1999 she did a cameo on the movieMan on the Moon (film)Man On The Moonas her character she played onTaxi (TV series)
Kane was nominated for anAcademy AwardforAcademy Award for Best ActressBest Actressfor her role in the filmHester Street (film)Hester Street.
article.heading: Theater
article.paragraph: She starred in theoff-BroadwayplayLove, Loss, and What I Worein February 2010.BWW News Desk." 'Love, Loss And What I Wore' Welcomes Comedic New Cast; Janeane Garofalo, Carol Kane & More Bow 2/3"broadwayworld.com, December 10, 2009

Kane made her West End debut in January 2011 in a major revival ofLillian Hellman's dramaThe Children's Hour (play)The Children's Hour, at London'sComedy Theatre. She starred alongsideKeira Knightley,Elisabeth MossandEllen Burstyn.Shenton, Mark.Ellen Burstyn and Carol Kane Join Cast of West End's Children's HourPlaybill.com, November 19, 2010
In May 2012, Kane appeared on Broadway as Betty Chumley in a revival of the playHarvey (play)Harvey.
Kane is known for her portrayal of the evil headmistressMadame Morriblein the Broadway musicalWicked (musical)Wicked, whom she played in various productions from 2005 to 2014.

Kane made herWickeddebut on the 1st National Tour, playing the role from March 9 through December 19, 2005. She then reprised the role in the Broadway production from January 10 through November 12, 2006. She again played the role for the Los Angeles production which began performances on February 7, 2007. She left the production on December 30, 2007, and later returned from August 26, 2008 until the production closed on January 11, 2009.

She then transferred with the L.A. company, to play the role once again, in the San Francisco production which began performances January 27, 2009.cite webhttp://www.theatermania.com/san-francisco/news/12-2008/garrison-kane-kassebaum-wicks-set-for-san-francisc_13504.htmlGarrison, Kane, Kassebaum, Wicks Set for San Francisco WickedDan BacalzoDecember 16, 2008She ended her limited engagement on March 22, 2009.cite webhttp://www.playbill.com/news/article/126830-Academy-Award-Winner-Duke-to-Join-Cast-of-San-Frans-WickedAcademy Award Winner Duke to Join Cast of San Fran's WickedAndrew GansMarch 2, 2009Kane returned to the Broadway company ofWicked (musical)Wickedfrom July 1, 2013 through February 22, 2014.cite webhttp://playbill.com/news/article/179391-Broadways-Wicked-Will-Welcome-Carol-Kane-and-Michael-WartellaBroadway's Wicked Will Welcome Carol Kane and Michael WartellaJune 21, 2013August 30, 2013
